WRITING.TEXT: Me too. I suffered from depression, anxiety and self harm before i got accepted. It has gotten 100x worse since i've gotten here but now I've lost anyone I cared about. I have zero people to talk to here let alone friends. My midterms have been ranging in the 65-80 range which for me is pretty fucking awful. I dont know how im even going to get through christmas because I have no where to go and I need to vacate residence. I fucking hate it here. If you come up with a suicide plan, let me in on it.
Not woodsworth. Im sitting in this hell right now and trust me.. not woodsworth.

From my very limited experience, I've only been attracted to one person in my life and it certainly was not because of his appearance. I truly loved this persons personality and more importantly how they treated me. I feel true love only comes from an emotional, built up bond. No love at first sight bullshit.

WRITING.TITLE: Said "End of Day" but never came
WRITING.TEXT: Yesterday, all day the tracking said it would come by the end of the day. But it never came and now it's back in an "in transit" status. I'm not sure why at this point it isnt even out for delivery again..? They never attempted delivery yesterday so im not sure whats happening.

WRITING.TITLE: Should I transfer?
WRITING.TEXT: Should I transfer to Western? I just started at UofT in september and the schools not bad I just absolutely hate residence and cannot afford to live in Toronto on my own. #8203; When I applied to schools i debated UofT or Western

WRITING.TITLE: Transferring to Western?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone. I currently go to UofT. The schools not bad but I cannot stand residence and have had a really hard time settling in here. #8203; When I got accepted to schools I debated Western or UofT. Should I make the switch?
Social science. Just gotta get through these few years so I can end up in law school. I heard both UofT law and Western Law is good so I'm not sure.

I just need my undergrad to get into Law school. My program at UofT currently is social science but It doesnt entirely matter I just need a useless undergrad to get into what I actually want to be doing. #8203; I don't have any friends or anything support here at UofT at least if I moved to London i'de be closer to family. I tend to run from any slight problem I have which is why I like getting advise on what might be right for me. i think things would improve at Western because I could afford to bypass the residence situation. I have anxiety and realized quickly after I came to UofT that being in a common apartment with 3 strangers wasn't ideal for me.

I have pretty unmanageable anxiety and depression. I thought a fresh start at UofT and being completely independent may kick my ass into growing out of this. But i realized quickly being moved into a shared apartment style residence with a couple of strangers wasn't helpful in any way.

Thank you all for your answers. I really appreciate the advice.

I meet the admission requirements for a transfer at Western but how do you apply for a transfer? #8203; Has anyone transferred before or know how to go about transferring? I emailed admissions a few times and they give me very general answers and take forever to respond

WRITING.TITLE: Transferring
WRITING.TEXT: Hey everyone. I'm a first year student here and would like to get the hell out of this place after I finish up this first year. Has anyone transferred schools before? Whats the process? I've contacted admissions of the school i want to attend but they are very slow at replying and reply too vaguely to be anywhere near helpful. #8203; Do I have to go through OUAC like I did in high school?
Mid-september? The deadline was mid-january to apply for universities when I applied last year. I didnt apply for UofT until Jan 1st last year.
I think your thinking about transferring for the winter term. Anyway, thanks for the help
Lol, why?
I don't believe I was looking for advice on my decision.

Oh really? I couldnt apply for a transfer if my grades were shit. It has nothing to do with the school. I actually enjoyed the classes I took here. It has to do with residence and Toronto in general. There are many benefits for me personally moving closer to home where I can afford to live off campus.

You have no idea why people intend to leave. We've all fucked up and made mistakes and we have no way of really knowing how a University will work out for us personally when we submit our applications. #8203; I suggest you stop judging people. It's not helping anyone. I also never referred to it as a hellhole.. "Get the hell out" is a strongly worded phrase for leaving.
Not a problem. You worried me for a second there!

I took it last semester and i'de suggest reading it. I know its painful and when you start reading it sounds like a repetition of the lecture. But there are definitely questions on term tests and the final exam about specific content from the textbook, primarily the little blurbs on experiments, specific real world examples, and what not. #8203;
gt;Award I second watching crash course. I still wouldnt know what the fuck she was talking about with neurotransmitters without it.

WRITING.TITLE: UTAPS
WRITING.TEXT: I'm a first year student so all this grant and osap stuff is a bit over my head. For the fall term I recieved my OSAP money, a grant from Woodsworth and UTAPS. #8203; I didnt get much from UTAPS but it was still crucial to paying for my fall term. This term I only got OSAP which paid the school directly... I still have quite a bit of an outstanding balance since I didnt recieve the two other grants. Was I supposed to apply for them? #8203; I thought UTAPS was automatically applied to through OSAP. And do colleges not give grants for both terms? #8203; I can't even afford to buy my textbooks for this semester and I have an outstanding balance. I got quite a bit of money first semester which really helped so I'm not sure what's changed.

I'm in Woodsworth. Besides the brief ant infestations in the fall that I like to blame my pig roommates for or the fact that they kept me all night one day before a test fucking around with the smoke alarms, it's ok. But i'm actually transferring next year because I hate residence and cannot afford to live off-campus in Toronto. I chose it at the top of my rankings when I applied because there were private bedrooms and from pictures I found online they seemed nicer than the other. Woodsworth is apartment style. My suite has 2 bathrooms, 5 people, single private bedrooms and a common kitchen and living space. Do a little research on them. I know its hard to make a decision on where you are going to live without seeing the place. I regret my decision. I pay way too much money for this residence and I cannot stand the people I was forced to live with #8203; If you can, I'de recommend off campus housing. If you have friends (unlike me) You'll probably end up paying less than I do for my prison cell type dorm room to which I am writing from while also choking on the price I saw on my invoice today. #8203; If you have any questions about Woodsworth let me know.
Question, are you transferring schools?

I found the old email, I received acceptance March 23rd last year. But they are very slow, I sent out my applications early Dec and they didnt even send an acknowledgment letter that they received it until late January so I think you are right to doubt your classmate.
Fuck, I'll hope for the February thing. Thanks for the info.

WRITING.TITLE: Question about Western
WRITING.TEXT: The UofT reddit page right now is going crazy with high school students asking for advice about the school and current students, including myself bitching about the school. I'm in UofT right now but want to transfer to Western next year. Before I submit the transfer application i'de like some advice because I know I would have appreciated it before I optimistically packed my bags for Toronto. #8203; Anything I should know about Western? Any advice you can give? I dont plan to live on campus at Western (Thank god, which is why im leaving UofT) #8203; #8203; #8203; #8203;

Thank you for putting in the time to write this, I really appreciate it. My program at UofT is in social sciences #8203; When I was picking schools I mostly focused on which has a better law school. Which is why I was debating UofT and Western. Is there anything you can tell me about that? My program right now doesnt matter as much to me and I'm thinking about applying to criminology, sociology and political science. I was also thinking about applying to Kings (I want to get in wherever they can fit me in) #8203; School politics and that do not concern me, I dont get involved in anything here at UofT and resent residence for the close proximity I have to be in with people who are loud, messy and crass. #8203; P.s thanks for info about the gym, the one here at my residence is super small, messy and some weird people go in there at the time that I can finally get in.

Thank you for replying, it's very helpful to hear from someone who has experience at both schools. My idea is to live off-campus. My sister lives near London and its much more practical to share costs with her to get a place off-campus than shelling out so much money to live in a crappy residence room in Toronto. #8203; Since you spent a few years there, did you hear anything about Western Law? When i finish my undergrad at Western I'll be considering whether to go back to Toronto for law school or stay at Western. I hear good things about both though.

I've been advocating this for years. Euthanasia laws in Canada should be expanded to cover depression. Depression isn't insanity and not curable in everyone. Why should people who are depressed and chronically suicidal like myself have to resort to some kind of terrible, inhumane method to die?

Thank you for the info on Kings! I was called by Western last year saying they did not have space for me in the program i wanted at main campus but offered me admission to Kings. Since i didnt know much about it I went with UofT. So this is very helpful! I have 3 applications so i was going to apply to poli sci and criminology in the main campus and I wanted one application to go to Kings. At UofT criminology is extremely popular so I'm worried about selecting criminology at Kings. Which program would be best to try to get into Kings? (Sociology, Poli Sci or Criminology?)
Just wanted to thank everyone for the help here! You guys are seriously so much nicer and optimistic than users on the UofT subreddit so I'm sensing my decision to leave UofT is a good one!

It's definitely self punishment for me at least. It's addicting because all the emotional pain turns into physical which to me is so much more bearable for me. I get into terrible fits out cryings, panic and my mind becomes overcome with terrible thoughts. If you've ever seen a cartoon with the character with those rings around their head indicating dizziness thats how it feels. Too many thoughts that overwhelm me. The only way to calm me down is cutting. Turning my sadness to anger and cutting myself completely calms me and the pain and headache I get from crying prior is like a sedative that puts me to sleep until i do it over again the next.
